channel.title: Client compiler
channel.description: what is the correct compiler code? my client compiler says it cannot find the path specified my code is....[code=abap]@echo off TITLE CompiLER "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.15\bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause [/code]

item.title: Client compiler
item.dc:creator: @Darthax Darthax
item.description:
@Darthax wrote:

um if we are the dumb fucks why are we the one tring to help you and my code should work if it is not working get a hole new sorce.

[quote=“Darthax, post:7, topic:334066”][quote author=youdunce2 link=topic=430458.msg3160466#msg3160466 date=1269485264]
@echo off
@your server name
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit
[/quote]

just copie and paste no need to change anything[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Client compiler
item.dc:creator: @ILOVEJAVA ILOVEJAVA
item.description:
@ILOVEJAVA wrote:

the cause is most likly cuz you either don’t have jdk or the version specified in the compiler is not consistant to the version you have on your comp. go to My Computer\C:\Program Files\Java\ and in your java folder, there should be another folder titled something like “jdk1.6” or some shit. also, you have your compiler code typed incorrectly, it’s:

@echo off
title compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\Jdk1.6.0_15\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

the “1.6.0” is the version and the “_15” is the update. so you don’t put a “.” after the “0”…lol…and you put “java.exe” but it’s javac.exe, and the c representing the compiler. hope that helped…

Read full topic
